title: How to Be an Effective Halo 3 Sniper

steps.headline: The number one rule you need to know is to never stop moving.
steps.description: A good sniper will only take one shot before moving to a new location. If you stay put after taking a shot-especially after hitting a target-you will be easier to track and kill.

steps.headline: Find a weapon worthy of headshots.
steps.description: The SRS99D Sniper Rifle and the Covenant Beam Rifle are the choice selects. These weapons have multiple zoom function and are relatively common.

steps.headline: Find a location that can serve as a "Sniper's Nest".
steps.description: These nests are usually in higher places with plenty of foliage, rocks, and other natural objects used to conceal you. A good sniper position can see vast distances of the map. All this allows a sniper to kill without being killed. And as said before, keep moving. A well-seasoned sniper will scope out multiple sniping posts before taking his first shot.

steps.headline: Be aware of your target's movement.
steps.description: When he/she jumps, shoot near the feet or where the head will be after they land. When your target strafes, look for a pattern or a break in the movement. If a target is trying to make a speedy getaway in a vehicle, you need to adjust your aiming speed according to that of the vehicle. When you see an opportunity to fire, take it.

steps.headline: Aim ahead of a moving target.
steps.description: This slight difference will account for where your target will be in a second. When they are in a vehicle, you have to aim further ahead than normal.

steps.headline: Carry a few grenades with you just in case your enemy gets close.
steps.description: A few sticks and your free of opposition. On the plus side, if your target has discovered your position, simply move to another location with a bead on your past spot. More than likely your enemy will return for revenge.

steps.headline: Be prepared to defend yourself against anyone who comes too close.
steps.description: As said above, grenades are good for that, but a close range weapon like a shotgun or assault rifle would be better suited in case you run out. Carrying a bubble shield or regenerator is also wise.
